page.title: 09LAW AND ORDER
page.content: LAW AND ORDER. The village does not have its own Police Station or any police personnel. The whole area is policed from Shrawbury which has one police officer on day duty only. Emergency calls after five p.m. or whenever local policemen are not on duty are dealt with from Shrewsbury. From the time an emergency call is logged in Shrewsbury a policeman could be in Stanton within fifteen minutes. Crime is almost none existant in the village and the country habit of leaving doors and windows unlocked when houses are unattended is still very much in evidence. On speaking to the oldest inhabitant we learned that no major crime had occured within the last fifty years.
